attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the deal made as part of the UK's Article 50 negotiations
attributes.additional_details:
One of the primary criticisms of the 2016 EU referendum has been the lack of information, conjecture and scaremongering over the could happens, maybes and the unknowns in possible future relationships with Europe.
The coming negotiations will produce a fundamental change to our country of which there has been no clear guidance as yet. We deserve the chance to consider the terms of change in comparison to our current situation in a free, open and fair way.
attributes.background: All UK residents should have a say on the terms & realities of Brexit in a fair comparison to our current situation. Article 50 negotiations between the UK & EU will mean extensive constitutional change. We the people have the right to have a say when full facts of leaving would be available.
